message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the purpose and occurrence of funerals. Funerals are common occurrences after a person has passed away, which is indicated by option (B) - when a person has ceased taking in oxygen and pumping blood through their system. Option (A) is incorrect because a routine doctor's appointment does not necessarily lead to a funeral. Option (C) is incorrect because being declared in remission from cancer means the person is recovering, not deceased. Option (D) is incorrect because having a big lunch has no direct relationship to funerals.

Option (D) is unrelated to death and funerals.
